trans-unit.source: Determines how a class or field is displayed in the debugger variable windows.
The <xref:System.Diagnostics.DebuggerDisplayAttribute.%23ctor%2A> constructor has a single argument: a string to be displayed in the value column for instances of the type.
This string can contain braces ({ and }).
The text within a pair of braces is evaluated as the name of a field, property, or method.
For example, the following C# code causes "Count = 4" to be displayed when the plus sign (+) is selected to expand the debugger display for an instance of `MyHashtable`.
For information about using this attribute in Visual Studio, see [Using the DebuggerDisplay Attribute](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f4eb7c76-af4e-493b-9ab6-9cb05949d9b3).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Diagnostics.DebuggerDisplayAttribute"></xref> class.
The `value` parameter can contain braces ({ and }).
The text within a pair of braces is evaluated as the name of a field, property, or method.
For example, the following C# code causes "Count = 4" to be displayed when the plus sign (+) is selected to expand the debugger display for an instance of `MyTable`.
The string to be displayed in the value column for instances of the type; an empty string ("") causes the value column to be hidden.
Gets or sets the name to display in the debugger variable windows.
The value can contain curly braces ({ and }).
Text within a pair of braces is evaluated as the name of a field, property, or method.
The name to display in the debugger variable windows.
Gets or sets the type of the attribute's target.
Use this property to specify the target type when the attribute is used at the assembly level.
The attribute's target type.
<xref href="System.Diagnostics.DebuggerDisplayAttribute.Target"></xref> is set to `null`.
Gets or sets the type name of the attribute's target.
Use this property to specify the name of the target type when the attribute is used at the assembly level.
The name of the attribute's target type.
Gets or sets the string to display in the type column of the debugger variable windows.
The string to display in the type column of the debugger variable windows.
Gets the string to display in the value column of the debugger variable windows.
This property contains the string passed in by the `value` parameter of the constructor.
The string to display in the value column of the debugger variable.
